titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. Frederick Kohlman, Indictment
CWG0922

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

body.p:
The Commonwealth of Kentucky,
AGAINST
Frederick Kohlman
Jefferson Circuit Court,
May Term, A. D. 1864.

The Grand Jurors of the County of Jefferson in the name and by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky, accuse Frederick Kohlman of the Crime of Grand Larceny committed in the manner and form as follows, to wit: The said Frederick Kohlman in the said County of Jefferson on the day of March A. D. 1864 feloniously took & Carried away one United States Treasury Note of the value & denomination of Twenty dollars, & another United States Note of the value & denomination of twenty dollars, & one United States Treasury Note of the value & denomination of two dollars, & divers & sundry United States Treasury notes of different sizes & denominations towit ones & twos amounting to the value of seventy four dollars then and there being found, the property of William Vondersider -- contrary to the form of the statute in such cases, made and provided against the peace and dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky.

J R Dupuy
Commonwealth's Attorney.
A Copy
Att Jas P Chambers C J C C
The within & foregoing indictment was returned by the Grand Jury a true bill. May 2. 1864. and in the 9 day of May 1864 said Case was given to the Jury who returned the following verdict

We of the Jury find the Accused guilty of the charge in the indictment & say he shall be Confined in the Jail & Penitentiary for the sum of one year, and under the existing Circumstances particularly recommend him to the Clemency of the Executive

A A Quarrie foreman
A Copy Att
Jas P Chambers C J C C

The accused is a boy -- this, I am satisfied, is his first offence. He proved a good character upon his trial and promises to live honestly in the future. This seems to me a proper case for Executive clemency and I respectfully ^ask^ your Excellency to grant him a pardon

P. B. Muir
J R Dupuy Com Atto.

Jefferson Cir Ct
vs
F. Kohlman
The Commonwealth of Kentucky.
Indictment.
vs }
Pardon Granted
Tho E Bramlette
Grand Larceny
One Year
A True Bill.
11th May/64
Foreman.
